page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 9: Line 9:
Another activist who was detained after the ousting of Mubarak was Maikel Nabil Sanad<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maikelnabil.com/2010/12/my-cv.html |title=About me |publisher=http://www.maikelnabil.com/ |date=2010-12-05 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref>. Sanad is a political activist and blogger, and in April 2009 he founded the "No to Compulsory Military Service Movement". As a pacifist, he declared his conscientious objection, and demanded to be exempted from military service. He was arrested on 12 November 2010, also by military police, but released two days later, and finally exempted from military service on medical grounds. Sanad participated actively in the Egyptian revolution, and especially highlighted the fact that Egypt has effectively been ruled by the military for six decades. He was arrested on 4 February by military police and tortured, but released 27 hours later. He was arrested in his home in the Ain Shams neighbourhood in Cairo at about 10PM on 28 March 2011 by military police. He was only able to call his brother on the next day, to inform him of his arrest<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wri-irg.org/node/12513 |title=Egyptian Pacifist Maikel Nabil Sanad Arrested for Insulting Military |publisher=http://www.wri-irg.org/ |date=2011-03-30 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref>. Sanad was sentenced to three years' imprisonment on charges of "insulting the military" in his post "The Army and The People Were Never One Hand"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maikelnabil.com/2011/03/army-and-people-wasnt-ever-one-hand.html |title=The Army and The People Wasn't Ever One Hand |publisher=http://www.maikelnabil.com/ |date=2011-03-08 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref> by the 10th of Ramadan military court in Nasr City near Cairo on 10 April 2011. Before, he was imprisoned in a special punishment cell at El Marg prison, which did not allow him to see any sun light. In addition, his cell mates threatened him. Sanad demanded to see a doctor, as he suffers from unstable blood pressure and needs regular medication and medical attention<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wri-irg.org/node/13004 |title=Imprisoned Pacifist Blogger Maikel Nabil Sanad in Solitary Confinement |publisher=http://www.wri-irg.org/ |date=2011-05-23 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref>.
Another activist who was detained after the ousting of Mubarak was Maikel Nabil Sanad<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maikelnabil.com/2010/12/my-cv.html |title=About me |publisher=http://www.maikelnabil.com/ |date=2010-12-05 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref>. Sanad is a political activist and blogger, and in April 2009 he founded the "No to Compulsory Military Service Movement". As a pacifist, he declared his conscientious objection, and demanded to be exempted from military service. He was arrested on 12 November 2010, also by military police, but released two days later, and finally exempted from military service on medical grounds. Sanad participated actively in the Egyptian revolution, and especially highlighted the fact that Egypt has effectively been ruled by the military for six decades. He was arrested on 4 February by military police and tortured, but released 27 hours later. He was arrested in his home in the Ain Shams neighbourhood in Cairo at about 10PM on 28 March 2011 by military police. He was only able to call his brother on the next day, to inform him of his arrest<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wri-irg.org/node/12513 |title=Egyptian Pacifist Maikel Nabil Sanad Arrested for Insulting Military |publisher=http://www.wri-irg.org/ |date=2011-03-30 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref>. Sanad was sentenced to three years' imprisonment on charges of "insulting the military" in his post "The Army and The People Were Never One Hand"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maikelnabil.com/2011/03/army-and-people-wasnt-ever-one-hand.html |title=The Army and The People Wasn't Ever One Hand |publisher=http://www.maikelnabil.com/ |date=2011-03-08 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref> by the 10th of Ramadan military court in Nasr City near Cairo on 10 April 2011. Before, he was imprisoned in a special punishment cell at El Marg prison, which did not allow him to see any sun light. In addition, his cell mates threatened him. Sanad demanded to see a doctor, as he suffers from unstable blood pressure and needs regular medication and medical attention<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wri-irg.org/node/13004 |title=Imprisoned Pacifist Blogger Maikel Nabil Sanad in Solitary Confinement |publisher=http://www.wri-irg.org/ |date=2011-05-23 |accessdate=2011-06-13}}</ref>.
